    MEP Engineer
    Company Name Burlingame Point LLC Company Location Burlingame, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    Company: Burlingame Point LLC

    Job Title: MEP Engineer

    Job Location: Burlingame, CA

    Job Summary:

    Burlingame Point, LLC, a multi-national commercial real estate investment and development company in San Francisco Bay Area is looking for a full time in-house MEP Engineer. The MEP Engineer/Coordinator is responsible for the daily management, supervision and coordination of the mechanical, hi-low voltage electrical, plumbing, fire protection and elevator design-build large scale commercial building projects, to meet time and cost and quality objectives with respect to contracting, and contract administration functions.

    This calibrated and professional is responsible for reviewing/monitoring commercial building construction MEP plans, specifications, subcontract construction bids, proposals/contracts, shop drawings, equipment purchase, change orders, monitor and control MEP contractors progress of work, field construction RFI, quality of workmanship. Verify and validate contractors’ payment applications, invoices, coordinate/monitor MEP equipment installation, testing, commissioning. Develop and execute equipment operation and maintenance programs.

    Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities

    • Assist Project Manager, during pre-construction and construction operations in MEP system engineering review, monitor field construction implementation, contract administration

    • Review, evaluate MEP engineering consultants and contractors proposals, designs, specifications, bids, contracts, RFI, change orders

    • Review, evaluate, validate and approve contractors material and equipment submittals prior to installation

    • Attend design and construction coordination meetings to monitor project progress.

    • Assist owners’ construction management team to monitor MEP/FP/Elevators/Low Voltage construction work on site

    • Review, verify, validate, contractors invoices and payment requests, construction expenditures

    • Generate construction and work progress reports, project financial status and cost control reports

    • Monitor the installation and start-up of MEP systems and equipment testing and commissioning, As-Built drawings, control MEP System equipment warranty of project with Engineers, Contractors

    • Assist property management team in operation and maintenance of buildings’ MEP systems

    • Other assignments given by senior management

    Qualifications:

    • 5 to 7+ years of combined experience in MEP design, construction, coordination and management of commercial building operations and maintenance
    • Proficient knowledge of mechanical, electrical, plumbing and low-voltage systems
    • Understanding of Building Codes, Mechanical Codes, Electrical Codes and Plumbing Codes, Fire Codes as they relate to design and construction of project. Able to read, understand, interpret construction plans, specification, operation maintenance manuals
    • Bachelor’s degree in MEP Engineering and/or Construction Management a plus
    • Knowledge of construction standards, methods, practices required
    • Experienced dealing with MEP design consultants, contractors and equipment suppliers
    • Central Utility Plant experience is a plus

    Communication Skills:

    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to effectively present information. Ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable status reports to project management team.

    Other Skills:

    Intermediate to advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite, CAD Applications

    To Apply:

    Forward resume and cover letter to monty@kylli.com. We look forward to hearing from you.

    Description

    Bring up and test wireless SoC, Perform system integration, characterization and optimization.

    Perform conducted and radiated RF measurements of devices and systems.

    Work with design engineers to develop test plan, analyze test data and generate test reports.

    Research and develop advanced calibration and measurement techniques.

    Evaluate and specify test instruments. Develop test fixtures and test setup.

    Automate repetitive measurements using standard scripting languages.

    Education Details

    Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering preferred.

    Key Qualifications

    The ideal candidate will have 10+ years of wireless system characterization experience in communication system on chips.

    Deep understanding RF measurement techniques and lab procedure.

    Fundamental facility with RF measurement instruments, vector network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, vector signal analyzers, high-speed oscilloscopes, vector signal generators.

    Experience with wireless system FW/SW regression test

    Experience with digital interfaces including PCIe/USB/UART/I2C/JTAG

    Experience with production test systems.

    Familiarity with radiated measurements, antennas, chambers, and calibration.

    Proficiency with measurement automation tools and scripting languages such as, SCPI, Python, TCL, Labview, Matlab.

Performs all maintenance. 8. Ensures that all established rules, regulations, policies and procedures are strictly adhered to. 9. Performs all other duties, which may be assigned by the Director of Facilities/Engineering, or any other authorized Supervisors. 10. Formulate bill of materials to accomplish all tasks. 11. Systematically prepare to assume job assignments ensuring necessary equipment, parts and materials are available and task’s can be accomplished efficiently and safely. 12. Have knowledge of MSDS booklet location for your area. 13. Be familiar with OSHA safety codes regarding chemicals and electrical equipment. 14. Requires the ability to use and carry job related equipment.

    Minimum Qualifications: 1. Ability to read and interpret blue prints, schematic drawings, and technical specifications, etc. 2. Master Electrical Engineer thoroughly familiar with all electrical distribution systems, switchgear operations, panel operations, and electrical devices. 3. Knowledge of proper operation of electrical testing equipment and special tools. 4. Must have the ability to obtain Gaming work card for jurisdiction in which the property is located. 5. Must be at least 21 years of age.

    Engineer
    Company Name Intertek Company Location Menlo Park, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Essential Duties And Responsibilities

    This position is responsible for performing electrical testing and evaluation on a variety of products to the provisions of U.S., Canadian and other International product safety standards; writing reports; and communicating with clients.

    REPORTING STRUCTURE

    This position reports to

    EXAMPLES OF WORK

    Listed examples are illustrative and representative of the tasks required of this position and are not intended to be complete or exclusive.

    • Under the guidance of a more senior engineer, conduct on and off site evaluation of products to determine compliance with applicable standard(s). To do this, Engineer must:
    • Read and determine applicability of national codes and standards clauses for the EUT (equipment under test);
    • Read and understand schematics and manufacturing instructions;
    • Validate the project scope and sample applicability;
    • Under scope of the project, identify and locate test instruments and equipment required for testing;
    • Follow established test plan;
    • Set up and operate EUT; perform and document simple repairs on EUT as needed;
    • Conduct thorough construction review; document results;
    • Perform testing of products in accordance with standards. Core tests include, but are not limited to: rating, leakage current, dielectric, temperature, pressure, stability, mechanical hazard, flammability, abnormal and fault insurance, rain, radiation, sound, laser.
  • Complete preliminary design reviews (PDR) both on and off site.
  • Develop and set up test plans.
  • Set up and operate standard test equipment including, but not limited to, spectrum analyzer, oscilloscope, multi-meter, dielectric strength tester, ground continuity tester, digital multi-meter, surge generator, over-voltage tester, environmental condition chamber, articulated probes. Use hand tools to build/calibrate test fixtures.
  • Following sample handling procedures, ensure that sample is logged into and out of the system. Move equipment as needed through the facility. Properly package sample for shipment.
  • Compile test results during construction review and testing. Compile data and product description and type final report using established report shell. Submit report to reviewer for final approval.
  • Communicate project status and test results to client, sales personnel, and management throughout testing. Provide on-going support to clients as needed.
  • Within policy guidelines, identify, properly document, and recommend engineering judgments.
  • Perform other work as required

    • Education & Experience

    REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

    • Bachelors degree in engineering
    • 0-2 years directly related experience
    • Demonstrated experience with U.S., Canadian, and other International product safety standards, i.e., ANSI, CSA, UL, EN, IEC is a plus

    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS And ABILITIES

    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    • Excellent organization and time management skills
    • Excellent customer service skills
    • Must be self-motivated and able to work independently in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment
    • Prior project management experience is a plus
    • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
    • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables
    • Ability to make technical decisions and engineering judgments independently within established parameters
    • Microsoft Office expertise
  • Ability to travel as business needs dictate

    • This position outline is a general guideline and does not represent all encompassing details. The position assumes that the incumbent has both the mental and physical requirements to carry out the above defined duties.

    Deep Learning Engineer - Next big thing!
    Company Name CyberCoders Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Based in San Francisco, CA, we are and innovative and dynamic company that uses data to to understand patterns in the medical/surgical field. We use machine learning to discover these patterns and integrate augmented reality into clinical practice, hospital settings, operating rooms. We are revolutionizing the medical field with our disruptive technology and we are in need a visionary who is a technologist at heart, has a passion for machine learning, and building new technologies. We have a need for a Deep Learning Engineer who is an expert at developing tech that will help the medical field save lives. If this sounds like you, please read on!

    What's In It for You

    • Excellent Compensation!
    • Growing Company!
    • Generous PTO!
    • Ground Floor Opportunity!

    What You Will Be Doing

    You will be a crucial players in the augmented reality glasses engineering team using motion sensors and location sensors developing algorithms for context awareness and 3D cameras for localization, mapping and scene understanding. You'll lead development of DNNs using video frames from onboard and optically magnified cameras as input for recognizing or detecting, parsing or segmenting, anatomical structures from medical images in the video stream. DNNs will be optimized to run inference on neural compute ASICs and integrated GPUs onboard embedded heterogeneous computing platforms.

    You'll need exposure to deep learning concepts and models for training and running inference on multi dimensional medical data including time series, sensors, and images. You'll be a hands-on development lead as we iteratively build prototypes to validating minimum viable product variations using DNNs for pattern recognition and object detection. At the same time you'll architect data-flow models for fusing multi-dimensional data from medical devices, sensors and imaging systems.

    What You Need for this Position

    • 3+ Years professional experience
    • MS or PhD in Computer Science required
    • Working experience with Smart Glasses
    • Experience with Computer Vision and Augmented Reality
    • Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment
    • A solid engineering background with hands-on design and development experience.

    So, if you are a Deep Learning Engineer with experience, please apply today!

    Email Your Resume In Word To

    Software Engineer - DevOps
    Company Name Apple Company Location Cupertino, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Our team is building-out and supporting Apple Blob Store at scale. We are looking for DevOps Engineers (junior or senior) with various level of system administration skills but high level of enthusiasm for collaborating with software engineers and QA engineers to create streamlined, automated workflows in support of a highly distributed application at great scale.

    The successful candidate will enjoy using technology to automate solutions and optimize outcomes, implementing continuous integration and deployment in a challenging and fast paced environment.

    Description

    Join a bright DevOps team really integrated in a Dev Organization: we are not just called DevOps, we live it. Our unified goal (Dev/QA/Ops) is to support our distributed application at massive scale.

    We are perpetually working on improving processes and automation to better deploy and support our application with limited human touch.

    We are seeking Engineer/Sysadmin familiar with DevOps philosophy and necessary technical background. The role will focus on the automation of workflows, maintaining servers, web services performance tuning, implementing server monitoring, and performing other traditional UNIX server sysadmin tasks such as disaster recovery, security, troubleshooting, preventive maintenance.

    The main measure of our success is the respect of our (internal) customers SLA.

    The Ideal Candidate

    Has broad UNIX knowledge and skills (expected deeper on senior candidates).

    Is enthusiastic about collaborating with software developers to architect solutions.

    Has a driving passion to improve existing processes and systems.

    Independently identifies problem areas and creates elegant solutions.

    Has experience in building packages in at least one of the following: RPM, DEB or Gentoo.

    Nice to have: Javascript/Node.js experience, Java development experience.

    Education Details

    BS/MS degree or equivalent work experience

    Key Qualifications

    Expertise with Linux (any distro, but RHEL or derivative a plus). Standard UNIX utilities and programs, version control (Git, SVN), Apache, package management (RPM), configuration management (e.g. Puppet/Chef or equivalent), DNS, server virtualization with Xen and VMware, LDAP, server monitoring (Nagios or equivalent), cloud services (AWS S3/EC2/... or equivalent).

    Some exposure to databases as a DBA: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CouchDB, Redis or preferably Cassandra.

    Knowledge in creating shell/Python/Ruby script to automate distributed client-server or server-server workflows.

    Additional desired but not mandatory skills: Mac OS X, JavaScript, continuous integration and testing methodologies, agile development methodologies, Test Driven Development, ...

    Communication skills need to be adequate to enable proper sharing of information in and outside the team.

    of course good knowledge of Apple internal tools (iTrac/Verdad/Carnival/Hubble/...) is a plus.

    Additional Requirements

    N/A

    iOS Engineer
    Company Name ClassDojo Company Location San Francisco, CA, US

    Job description

    As an early iOS engineer at ClassDojo, you'll collaborate closely with product, design, and other engineers as part of a cross-functional development team, creating incredible new experiences for our users. In addition, you’ll keep building on our world-class engineering culture, one that values rapid iteration, cross-functional collaboration, and thoughtful best practices.

    Responsibilities

    • You'll shape the direction of mobile products at ClassDojo.
    • You'll work across all parts of the stack to develop new features and infrastructure for ClassDojo's iOS app.
    • You'll create a solid architectural, technical and cultural foundation for future iOS engineers.
    • You'll be expected and encouraged to think beyond writing code, to help define ClassDojo's direction - this is your company to build.
    • You'll work and grow as part of a cross-functional product development team. We value holistic ownership over specialization, so you'll be expected to contribute beyond just iOS development.

    Requirements

    • 3+ years of experience with iOS
    • Enjoy building highly responsive and fault tolerant apps
    • Write robust application code for user-facing iOS applications on top of RESTful APIs
    • Create and maintain testing infrastructure for automated UI tests and end to end integration tests
    • Strong, a strong full-stack engineering background

    About ClassDojo

    ClassDojo’s mission is to give teachers, parents, and students the power to create incredible classrooms. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, California, ClassDojo is a classroom communication app that helps students build social-emotional skills while creating a simple way for teachers, parents, and students to share what’s happening during the school day through photos, videos, and messages. We're one of the fastest growing education technology companies of all time, used and loved by millions of teachers, parents and students in 90% of K-8 schools in the US, and 180 other countries.

    The Team

    We believe focused, talented, non-hierarchical teams can achieve a surprising amount. Our team is made up of engineers, designers, and educators from around the world, with deep backgrounds in public and charter schools, as well as from Facebook, Google, Dropbox, Airbnb, Amazon, Y Combinator and more. We’re building a company that will transform education and one that is the kind of place we’ve all always wanted to work. We believe you’ll do the best work of your life here.

    If you're excited about having an impact in education at massive scale, we'd love to hear from you.

    Science Lab Instructional Assistant - 45%/engineering And Physics
    Company Name Santa Rosa College Company Location Santa Rosa, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Description Benefits Supplemental Questions

    Filing Deadline: Friday, December 22, 2017

    It is the candidate's responsibility to be sure that ALL required materials are submitted by 5:00 p.m. on the filing deadline.

    Candidate selected must pass a pre-employment physical (at District's expense).

    Compensation And Benefits

    • Salary Range: $26.48 - $32.20 per hour (2016/17 Classified Salary Schedule); maximum initial placement at $29.20 per hour (placement within this range is based on assessment of previous experience as documented in application materials).
    • Fringe Benefits: The District offers a competitive health & benefits package for employees and eligible dependents (benefits are pro-rated for part-time employees).
    • Leave/Holiday Time: Full-time classified members earn 8 hours of sick leave and start off accruing 6.67 hours of vacation for each month worked (accrual rate increases after third year of employment and rates are pro-rated for part-time employees). Employees are also compensated for holidays recognized by the District (14 holidays/year, pro-rated for part-time employees).

    Classified employees are required to become a dues paying member of the Service Employee's International Union SEIU), or pay a service fee.

    Job Description

    The Engineering and Physics disciplines (housed within the Engineering & Applied Technology and Chemistry & Physics Departments) of Santa Rosa Junior College is seeking an energetic, detail oriented individual with demonstrated organizational, technical, and laboratory skills to join an outstanding team of faculty, staff and administrators to provide high quality programs and services to our District, our community, and most importantly to our students. Under general supervision, perform preparatory work to assist faculty in the instruction of college level students; demonstrate theoretical and practical subject matter in the department's laboratory settings; perform technical duties in the operation and maintenance of the laboratories and equipment; follow established policies concerning use and disposal of hazardous materials/wastes; and perform related work as required. This position is split between two primary disciplines: a transfer-level engineering program with focus on materials and circuits; and a transfer-level physics program spanning mechanics, electromagnetism, and modern physics. This is a regular, part-time, 45% , 238 days Classified position. The tentative work schedule will be Monday through Thursday with the hours to be determined based on the need of the department. (e.g., M/W 12:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m. and T/TH 4:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.) Position may be eligible for a 5% shiff differential per the SEIU Contract, Appendix H. Appointments are contingent upon funding and Board approval.

    Scope

    The Science Laboratory Instructional Assistant provides technical and instructional support to faculty and students in the technology laboratories within a college science department or programs such as Chemistry, Biological Sciences, Physics, Earth and Space Sciences, Agriculture, Natural Resources, etc. The Science Laboratory Instructional Assistant has an indepth knowledge in the science area to which assigned.

    Distinguishing Characteristics

    The Science Laboratory Instructional Assistant is distinguished from the Science Laboratory Technician by the instructional focus and assistance to faculty in instruction.

    Department/Program Description

    The Engineering & Applied Technology Department has four fulltime faculty and approximately twenty adjunct faculty with a variety of backgrounds and a passion for teaching. The Engineering & Applied Technology department has five main areas of teaching: engineering courses for students transferring to a university in those fields; courses in civil engineering technology, surveying, and GIS; courses in electronics and mechatronics; courses in architecture and interior design; and courses related to CADD, 3D modeling and animation. The Chemistry & Physics Department has eleven full-time faculty and 15 adjunct faculty. Both departments maintain high academic standards and place primary emphasis on quality undergraduate education with a strong commitment to helping our students succeed. Both have very knowledgeable and enthusiastic faculty, and are committed to academic excellence, student success, and a collaborative work environment. We are looking for someone who shares these values.

    Department facilities include lecture halls and labs equipped with projection systems, computer workstations and discipline-related software. In addition, the labs are equipped with discipline-related devices such as materials testing equipment, surveying equipment, electronics equipment, light manufacturing equipment, and robotics equipment.

    Examples of Duties:Examples of key duties are interpreted as being descriptive and not restrictive in nature.

    • Sets up laboratory for demonstrations and exercises; distributes and arranges equipment, models and other related materials; performs preparation, setup and issuing of materials and equipment for use in demonstrations, experiments, exercises and exams; assists in the operation and maintenance of instructional labs; participates in the planning and implementation of exercises and experiments; implements new or modified policies and procedures as required; prepares special instructions for nonroutine and complex assignments.
    • Researches new developments in the disciplines of our department; consults with instructors to modify and incorporate changes into laboratory activities.
    • Confers with students regarding classroom or laboratory progress; tutors students individually and in groups in problem areas related to instructional subject matter.
    • Administers and scores laboratory exams and/or quizzes; confers with instructors and students regarding student test scores; maintains test records, laboratory attendance records and other related records.
    • Prepares reports on classroom or laboratory activities and/or student progress.
    • Order lab supplies and equipment; receives, stores, issues and maintains lab supplies and equipment.
    • Prepares, tests, adjusts, modifies, maintains, calibrates and operates a variety of laboratory equipment; troubleshoots problems and makes minor repairs and adjustments as necessary or arranges for service repair.
    • Demonstrates the safe and proper use of laboratory equipment and materials to students.
    • Implements departmental policies and procedures to comply with Federal, State and local hazardous materials, health and safety and hazardous waste regulations; enforces laboratory safety procedures, routinely inspects and/or tests safety equipment and supplies; responds to laboratory injuries and emergencies.
    • Attend departmental and instructional meetings.
    • Organizes and/or presents at special events and completes special projects as assigned.
    • May direct the work of student assistants.

    Minimum Qualifications

    EMPLOYMENT STANDARDS

    Ability To

    Present classroom materials; maintain accurate computerized records, databases, reports and files; interpret and apply policies and procedures, rules and regulations; communicate effectively in English; follow and give oral and written directions; identify problems and recommend solutions; work independently with a minimum of supervision; work effectively with others contacted in the course of work; perform analytical work needed to help develop laboratory instructions and materials in the department's laboratory environments; set up lab equipment and materials; direct or perform experiments and demonstrations in the area assigned; understand the function of and be able to operate, demonstrate, maintain, troubleshoot, repair and/or calibrate technical laboratory equipment; research, adapt and apply lab methods, practices and techniques common to technology labs; collect and analyze laboratory data; purchase or arrange for the purchase of laboratory supplies and equipment; handle, store and dispose of hazardous materials; update knowledge in keeping with changing environmental health and safety regulations and advances related to the department's disciplines; maintain cooperative working relationships; demonstrate sensitivity to, and respect for a diverse population.

    Knowledge Of

    Specific subject matter and theoretical principles of either electronics, mechatronics, surveying, and/or materials engineering; materials, tools and equipment, supplies and laboratory methods, practices and techniques used in the above disciplines; materials and equipment used in the repair, calibration and maintenance of technical laboratory equipment? principles, practices, and environmental health and safety regulations necessary to properly work with laboratory equipment and use and dispose of hazardous materials; functional computer skills and principles of record keeping.

    Minimum Qualfications

    Candidates/incumbents must meet the minimum qualifications as detailed below, or file for equivalency. Equivalency decisions are made on the basis of a combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities. If requesting consideration on the basis of equivalency, an Equivalency Application is required at the time of interest in a position (equivalency decisions are made by Human Resources, in coordination with the department where the vacancy exists, if needed.)

    Required Education And Experience

    • A bachelor's degree in engineering, physics, or related technological discipline

    Preferred Experience

    • Relevant work experience in an educational setting
    • Experience in engineering related to electronics, materials engineering, and/or physics

    License Or Certificate

    This classification requires the use of a personal or District vehicle while conducting District business. Must possess a valid (Class C) California driver's license and an acceptable driving record.

    Special Requirements

    May be required to possess certain licenses or certificates (e.g., valid Class C California driver's license, CPR, First Aid certificate), or possess proof of training in areas relevant to subject matter to which assigned. Must be able to perform physical activities, such as, but not limited to, lifting heavy items (up to 50 lbs. unassisted), bending, standing, climbing or walking. Candidate selected must pass a pre-employment physical (at the District's expense).

    Application Procedures

    Supplemental Information:

    In order to be given consideration for this position, applicants must submit the following documents by the filing deadline:

    • A completed Santa Rosa Junior College Employment Application and responses to Agency-wide Questions. Please provide contact information (phone number and email address) for three professional references.
    • If applicable, completed Equivalency Form and supporting documents:https://hr.santarosa.edu/sites/hr.santarosa.edu/files/ClassEquivApp.pdf
    • A brief cover letter explaining your interest in the position, including how you meet the requirements and are qualified to perform the duties as listed in the "Key Duties and Responsibilities" section of this job announcement.
    • Current Resume.
    • If applicable, transcripts of all college level course work, including confirmation of degrees (unofficial copies acceptable (both sides), but official transcripts must be submitted prior to hiring). If transcripts are from an institution outside of the United States, applicants must provide a formal evaluation of their foreign degree(s) at the time of application. Contact the Human Resources Department for more information.
    • A current DMV Driver report (within the last six (6) months verifying a good driving record.

    PLEASE SUBMIT ONLY MATERIALS REQUESTED.

    Following the filing deadline, applications which are complete for screening will be reviewed by a screening committee. Approximately 2-3 weeks later, Human Resources will notify you whether or not you have been selected for interview. Those applicants most suitably qualified for the position/pool will be invited to interview with a Screening Committee. The Screening Committee may include representatives from the Faculty, the Administration, the Classified Staff, the Associated Students, and the Board of Trustees.

    If you are in need of special services or facilities due to a disability in order to apply or interview for this opening, please contact the Human Resources Department.

    More About Srjc Human Resources

    PHYSICAL ADDRESS: 1988 Armory Drive

    MAILING ADDRESS: 1501 Mendocino Avenue, Santa Rosa, CA 95401

    PHONE: (707) 527-4954

    The office is located in the Button Building on the Santa Rosa campus. All documents included in your online employment application become the property of the District. Your employment application for this opening will not automatically be considered for future openings. New employment application(s) must be submitted for each opening.

    CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT (Prior To Beginning Employment)

    • In accordance with Federal Law all employees must provide proof of eligibility to work in the United States;
    • Must be fingerprinted and have background clearance (at applicant's expense);
    • Candidate selected must pass a pre-employment physical (at District's expense); and
    • Must take a TB test (once hired and every four years thereafter).

    Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Jeanne Clery Disclosure)

    Sonoma County Junior College District's annual security report includes statistics for the previous three years concerning reported crimes that occurred on campus; in certain off-campus buildings or property owned or controlled by Sonoma County Junior College District; and on public property within, or immediately adjacent to and accessible from, the campus. The report also includes institutional policies concerning campus security, such as policies concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. You can read or obtain a full copy of this report by going to https://police.santarosa.edu/. Paper copies of the full report are available upon request by contacting Police Department Records at (707) 527-4963 or by coming to the Sonoma County Junior College District Police Department located at 2032 Armory Drive, Pedroncelli Center, Santa Rosa Campus.

    Equal Employment Opportunity

    SRJC attracts and retains the most qualified faculty and staff from diverse backgrounds. This is achieved through an inclusive recruitment strategy and a rigorous, thorough hiring process that begins with the fair and consistent evaluation of each application for minimum qualifications and demonstrated skills specific to each position/assignment. Because the ability to serve students from broad cultural heritages, socioeconomic backgrounds and genders is a key commitment of the District mission, SRJC actively encourages applications from candidates who recognize the value that diversity brings to a professional educational community.

    The Sonoma County Junior College District does not discriminate on the basis of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, ethnic group identification, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic condition, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or sexual orientation in any of its policies, procedures or practices; nor does the District discriminate against any employees or applicants for employment on the basis of their age. This non-discrimination policy covers admission, access and treatment in District programs and activities--including but not limited to academic admissions, financial aid, educational services and athletics--and application for District employment.

    The Sonoma County Junior College District is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

    SOC STA Engineer
    Company Name Apple Company Location Cupertino, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Join Apple’s growing wireless silicon development. In this highly visible role, as part of a highly talented team you will be at the heart of the wireless chip design effort interfacing with all disciplines (vertical product model) with critical impact in getting functional products to millions of customers quickly.

    Core Responsibilities

    Description

    As a Wireless ASIC STA engineer, you will be a part of the Wireless SOC digital design team responsible for providing integrated solutions for wireless chips.

    • Full chip and block level timing closure ownership throughout the entire project cycle (RTL, synthesis, and physical implementation)
    • Develop and maintain methodology and flows related to timing verification and closure
    • Generation of block and full chip timing constraints
    • Analyze timing reports and utilize scripting techniques to develop insights and drive rapid timing closure
    • Support digital chip integration work and flows

    Education Details

    Key Qualifications

    BSEE is required. MSEE is preferred.

    The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Background

    The position requires thorough knowledge of the ASIC design timing closure flow and methodology.

    - At least 5+ years hands-on experience in ASIC timing constraints generation and timing closure-

    • Expertise in STA tools (such as Primetime) and methodologies for timing closure with a good understanding of OCV, noise and cross-talk effects on timing
    • Familiarity with all aspects of timing closure of high-performance, mixed-signal SoCs in advanced process technology nodes (28nm and below)
    • Knowledge of timing corners/modes and process variations
    • Knowledge of low-power techniques including clock gating, power gating and multi-voltage designs
    • Proficient in scripting languages (Tcl and Perl)
    • Strong communication skills are a pre-requisite as the candidate will interface with a lot of different groups (e.g. digital design, verification, DFT, physical design, etc.).
    • Self starter and highly motivated
    • Familiarity with RTL, synthesis, logic equivalence, DFT, floor-planning, and backend related methodology and tools

    JobID: 113234469



    GNSS Navigaton Engineer
    Company Name Huawei Technologies Company Location Mountain View, California
    Job Link

    Job description

    The GNSS Navigation Engineer is responsible for GNSS navigation algorithm design and development. This role requires analysis of positioning software and algorithm; designing and implementing innovative sensor and information fusion approaches to improve accuracy, reliability, and power consumption of GNSS solution on mobile and wearable devices.Click to edit.

    DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

    • Responsible for development of multiple constellation real-time navigation software, including least square, Kalman filter, satellite selection, multipath detection and mitigation, to build an efficient, robust, and high performance GNSS navigation software.

    • Design and implement GNSS and sensor fusion algorithms for performance enhancements in challenging environments

    • Optimize performance of navigation algorithm given other sensor inputs and signals of opportunity while simultaneously addressing system level power consumption and other constraints.

    JOB SPECIFICATIONS

    Education:

    Minimum: Master's Degree

    Preferred: Doctoral/Professional Degree

    Major/Discipline: Geomatics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Related Field

    Relevant Work Experience

    Minimum: 3+ years of location industry experience

    Preferred: 5+ years of location industry experience

    Skills & Abilities:

    Minimum Requirements:

    • Strong mathematical and analytical abilities

    • Demonstrated ability to work as a team player, as part of a local and globally distributed team

    • Must be a self-motivated engineer with good task execution skills to deliver high quality output in timely manner

    Preferred:

    • Strong and Hands-on experience of GNSS measurement processing, optimal estimation or data fusion techniques (e.g. Least Square, Kalman Filter)

    • Experienced in development and debugging of positioning products required

    • 3+ years of location industry experience

    Equal Opportunity Employer

    As an equal opportunity employer, we hire without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

    Substrate DFM Engineer
    Company Name Apple Company Location Cupertino, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Apple products are as beautiful on the inside as they are on the outside. Inside every one of our products, are some of the world's most challenging consumer PCBA and Flex designs. Imagine yourself as a select member of the team that brings these assemblies from concept to high volume manufacturing.

    Description

    In the role of Substrate DFM engineer you will be focused on printed circuit boards, flexible printed circuits organic and ceramic substrates.

    The Responsibilities Of This Position Are

    Work as a member of a cross-functional team to ensure manufacturability of printed circuit designs.

    Maintain and enforce printed circuit specifications for external suppliers.

    Evaluate printed circuit supplier capabilities and control systems.

    Determine feasibility and provide approval for the use of new technologies on Apple programs.

    Suggest alternative solutions where cost reduction opportunities exist or design limitations require

    A strong knowledge of materials used throughout the electronics industry.

    Experience with technologies such as rigid-flex, embedded components, etc. is preferred.

    The ability to evaluate options and make critical decisions under uncertainty and deadline.

    A creative thought processes.

    Firefox Telemetry Engineer
    Company Name Mozilla Corporation Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Berlin, London, Mountain View, Paris, Remote, San Francisco, Toronto, Vancouver

    Thetargetlocationsforthispositionare;Berlin, MountainView,SanFrancisco,Portland,Toronto,Vancouver,Paris,London,Denver,orRemoteinoneofthosecountries.

    At Mozilla we want to make Firefox a delightful product for our users. We are collecting and processing terabytes of data a day from hundreds of millions of users to improve Firefox, build data driven features, and foster a data-informed culture. We need your help.

    You will be working with a talented group of engineers, product managers, and data scientists to make the Web a better place and impact the everyday lives of our users. Our goal is to empower our colleagues in making Firefox better than ever.

    As a Telemetry Engineer At Mozilla

    • You will contribute to the Firefox Telemetry system by adding new features
    • You will improve the quality of Firefox Telemetry by diagnosing and solving problems
    • You will work with different teams to help them instrument features in Firefox or other products
    • You will work on features across multiple platforms and technologies

    Your Professional Profile

    • BS/MS in CS, CE or similar field... or 3+ years relevant work experience
    • Proficiency with one or more of the following languages: JavaScript, C++, Rust
    • Experience working on client applications (mobile or desktop)
    • Experience working on cross-platform applications (Windows, Mac, Linux, Mobile)
    • Ability to work collaboratively with a distributed team
    • Ability to work with other teams across an organization
    • Ability to clearly communicate verbally and in writing

    We’re Excited To See Any Additional Experience With

    As our team works across multiple areas, you should be curious and be interested in learning new things.

    • Modern web development, Rust or Python scripting
    • Using data to improve products
    • Delivering cross-platform client applications on Desktop or mobile
    • Working on a large code-base

    If you have different experiences and skills from the ones listed above but have something else to contribute, please contact us.

    Mozilla is a global organization, and this role is available in Europe or North America. You must have work authorization in one of these countries (we cannot hire anyone on a student visa at this time). We support flexible work hours, paid professional development, and have a wellness program that includes childcare assistance.

    About Mozilla

    Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe open and free is better than closed and controlled. Join us to work on products that promote choice and transparency and give people more control over their lives online. Mozilla is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity throughout our recruiting and hiring process and is dedicated to increasing diversity in our workplace.

    Open Source Engagement Engineer
    Company Name Mozilla Corporation Company Location Mountain View, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Berlin, London, Mountain View, Paris, San Francisco

    Open Source Engagement Engineer

    Mozilla’s Open Innovation team is driving the ways in which the organization works effectively beyond its own boundaries.

    That includes

    • Being deliberate about the role our products and technologies play in any particular market
    • Being clear on decision-making and participation models for our open source projects
    • Engage interested parties throughout our product development lifecycle

    To bring this strategy to life, Mozilla needs a versatile and established expert in open source, with technical knowledge and leadership skills who is able to work across the organization to advance Mozilla’s open source projects, both in capabilities and in contributor reward.

    Success will mean that projects are strategically adapted to the markets they exist in and are functionally suited to the needs of desired participants. A good project is one that will reward and retain its contributors and produce software with market, and therefore ultimately user, impact.

    Beyond that, we want to advance the state of open source. This means we will be implementing new tools and processes within our open source programs to improve the quality of software, to make projects more sustainable, and to increase diversity of participation within projects.

    We’re looking for a community engineer who has established themselves as a leader in building successful open source software. If you are an experienced open source engineer, with software development and communications skills and a desire to lead, inspire, and support others, we would like to talk to you. If you retain a leadership position within an open source project that you do not wish to relinquish, we are open to including this within your responsibilities.

    This is a good fit for you if you have experience...

    • Building and leading established open source projects
    • Advocating for open source within technology organizations
    • Engaging with business strategies of technology organizations
    • Sustaining healthy, diverse, open communities
    • Speaking and creating written content that moves others to action
    • Mentoring people of all levels both in person and online
    • Working as a professional developer or programmer
    • Being associated with an open source project that is related to a Mozilla project, or a project that we rely on.

    Your Responsibilities

    Advising on design of open source communities across Mozilla

    • Identifying possible stakeholders and contributors to an open source project and understanding their needs.
    • Provide guidance to teams on building and managing open source collaboration infrastructure, tools, and processes.
    • Advising teams within Mozilla on QA, incentivization, retention, release management, governance and licensing models in line with their specific market conditions and strategies.
    • Prioritize community health and diversity in our design of new programs.

    Documenting and disseminating best practices in open source across a network of leaders at Mozilla

    • Operating an internal network of interest in the topic of open source
    • Working with the open source experiment team to funnel successful experiments into the open source communities across Mozilla and beyond
    • Identifying and deploying new ways of working in open source across the industry that are showing good results and can be implemented in Mozilla communities.

    Provide ongoing consulting support to open innovation projects

    • Driving and supporting change within the organization towards open practices.
    • Handling goals and measures that speak to impact and theories of change, including building reporting methods
    • Shape strategies, workshops/summits and resources for OI initiatives – including professional development, recognition and progression
    • Support and advice on OI community development, including being the voice and evangelist for open source student clubs.

    Retaining an active leadership role in an existing open source project

    • Fulfilling the duties of a maintainer or similar status within a recognized project (ideally one related to Mozilla projects, or one that Mozilla recognizes through the Mozilla Open Source Support program).

    About You

    You'll be successful in this role if:

    • You have hands-on experience in open source projects
    • You’ve been in software development for at least 10 years
    • You have deep knowledge of Web technologies
    • You have a wide range of technical interests
    • You understand the motivations of individuals and of organizations to invest in open source development
    • You have a broad technical understanding
    • You’re know how to influence people
    • You like speaking in public
    • Are able to undertake a reasonable amount of travel

    About Mozilla

    Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe open and free is better than closed and controlled. Join us to work on products that promote choice and transparency and give people more control over their lives online.

    Mozilla is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity throughout our recruiting and hiring process and is dedicated to increasing diversity in our workplace.

    • Works with the Plant Manager and the management team of the departments served by the project to create a charter, including user requirements as needed, for the project
    • Works with the Plant Manager and/or the sponsors from the departments served by the project to resolve issues requiring their support.
    • Maintains project dashboards and other reporting tools to provide both visual management on projects and the overall portfolio, as well as executive summaries
    • Trains others on project methodology and tools.
    • Works with the Plant Manager or department managers to create and present capital acquisition plans.
    • Identifies areas of risk, monitors them throughout the project, and reports to sponsors and customer groups.
    • May provide feedback on team member performance.
    • Manages the development of project teams including teambuilding, motivating, etc.
    • May involve 5-10% travel.
    • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in relevant technology/expertise.
    • 5+ years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
    • Strong Project management skills.
    • Lean Six Sigma certification and/or experience preferred.
    • Knowledge of industry practices and company policies and procedures.
    • Solid analytical skills including data collection and synthesis.
    • Interpersonal and presentation skills.
    • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Visio, and Project software.
    • Proficient in standard project management tools (e.g., work breakdown structures, Gantt charts, critical path analysis) to document and communicate project plans.
    • Able to deal with moderate to high levels of uncertainty.
    • Able to facilitate conflict resolution with limited assistance.
    • Strong knowledge of SAP and data extraction capabilities.

    About Bio-Rad

    Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.

    Adv Rendering & GPU Compute Engineer
    Company Name Apple Company Location Cupertino, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Apple’s GPU Software team provides the graphics software foundation across all of Apple's innovative products, including iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, Mac, and Apple Watch. Our responsibilities encompass the frameworks, developer tools, and device drivers for the GPU and Display on all of Apple’s hardware.

    This team recently announced Metal 2 which provides near-direct access to the graphics processing unit (GPU), enabling you to maximize the graphics and compute potential of apps on iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS. Building upon an efficient low-overhead architecture with precompiled shaders, fine-grained resource control, and multithreading support, Metal 2 further boosts performance by enabling the GPU to take more control of the rendering pipeline. Moving beyond just graphics, Metal 2 provides deep support for GPU-accelerated machine learning and offers enhanced developer tools that make it even easier to debug, optimize, and deploy Metal apps. On Mac, Metal 2 adds support for virtual reality (VR) rendering and external GPUs, and provides new APIs and optimizations to help developers embrace these emerging technologies within their apps.

    Description

    The Advanced Compute and Rendering team is looking for a highly motivated software engineer to work on GPU-accelerated machine learning algorithms. In this role, you will be responsible for driving the design and implementation of highly optimized deep learning algorithms for the GPU. The scope of these efforts ranges from defining and implementing APIs in the MetalPerformanceShaders framework, investigating new algorithms, performing in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on iOS GPUs and help influence the design of compute and programming models in next-generation architectures on iOS and macOS.

    Education Details

    Technical BS/MS degree, PHD is a plus

    Key Qualifications

    Excellent programming skills and knowledge of C++

    A strong background in machine learning algorithms

    Expertise in high performance parallel programming. GPU programming experience (CUDA or OpenCL) a plus.

    Experience with GPU performance analysis and optimization

    Background in mathematics, including linear algebra and numerical methods

    Additional Requirements

    • Strong communication and teamwork skills
    • Strong track record of building high performance, production quality software on schedule.

    Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

    JobID: 53894775

    Senior Devops Engineer

    Senior Devops Engineer

    One of the South Bay’s emerging Cloud Access Security companies based out of Los Altos is looking for a Senior Devops engineer to join their team. The data ingest pipeline this company creates is one of the largest big data analytics clusters in the world, that can ingest a terabyte of data every hour. This Senior devops engineer looking to join the team will be working on continuous delivery infrastructure that enterprises trust for their mission critical cloud application security. As a member of this team, you will be responsible for automating software deployment, developing and scaling data ingest pipelines, building and running big data analytics cluster at massive scale, global data centers that run custom high performance hardware, developing auto-scaling system to smartly utilize thousands of servers, building global scale load balancing and monitoring for uptime and performance. This local company has invested heavily in building a world-class secure cloud. their DevOPS team builds, secures, manages and operates multiple locations across the globe. If you want to take on hard problems, solve complex problems to scale, geo-load-balance services, deliver on aggressive SLA’s this job is for you.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • 5+ years building, maintaining, hardening, scaling cloud apps
    • An expert Linux systems administrator with knowledge of process, networking and I/O internals. Knowledge of strace a plus.
    • Knowledge of hypervisors such as KVM, Xen, VMWare etc.
    • Experience in deployment automation using Ansible (preferred), Puppet or Chef
    • Prior experience in using monitoring tools for CPU, Network, Disk as well as applications
    • Experience in deploying, securing and scaling databases (MySQL and NoSQL)
    • Experience with Nginx
    • Work with little or minimal supervision

    Desired Skills & Experience

    • Be responsible for our production, beta, staging and lab environments
    • Deploy hardware and software
    • Build monitoring tools to measure performance and availability
    • Take proactive and remedial actions on detecting failures
    • Do day to day maintenance including patching systems and executing on business continuity and disaster recovery plans
    • Closely work with engineering team to build scale out services that are geo-load-balanced
    • Harden our network, host, application and database
    • Provide tools like log aggregation for engineering teams
    • Work with Engineering and Product Management on building processes and tools to meet with various compliance criteria such as SOC, ISO 270001 etc.
    • Mastery in Shell scripting. Knowledge of Python a plus.
    • BS or MS in Computer Science a plus

    Benefits & Perks

    Competitive Benefit Packages Including

    • Unlimited Vacation
    • 401 (k) plan
    • On site gym and entertainment
    • Friendly office culture

    Senior DevOps Engineer
    Company Name Jobspring Partners Company Location San Francisco, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Senior DevOps Engineer

    The world’s most popular cloud-based enterprise-class log management solution is seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to join their Software Engineer team in San Francisco. They are a rapid growing company and they are staffing up their San Francisco location as well as other parts of the US.

    The ideal candidate will have experience in building and scaling fast growing data based business. This role will be responsible for expanding out physical and AWS infrastructure, CI/CD Pipeline in Jenkins, as well as automating the entire environment. You will work closely with the rest of the company to ensure customer experience and improve the product.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • 5-10 years experience administering Big Data processing infrastructures capable of handling data in 100’s of TB to petabytes
    • Experience with private and public cloud environments (especially AWS), AWS services like Route 53, ELB, ADX, VPC, ElastiCache, RDS, S3 etc and AWS APIs.
    • Hands-on experience in designing and implementing automation systems for configuration management and code deployment
    • Work with geographically distributed systems and complex network topologies.
    • A high level of experience with open source tools and the OSS community.
    • Networking knowledge (TCP/IP, firewall, load-balancing, etc.)
    • Excellent Unix/Linux server administration skills, including package management, bare metal installations, and virtualization.
    • Data center build-outs and management (power and HVAC calculations, rack and stack, lights out management).
    • Excellent system automation experience with Ansible or puppet, or chef
    • Excellent scripting skills in shell, python ruby or perl,
    • Solid understanding of Java applications, memory, and JVM management.
    • Knowledge of security best practices, policies, and procedures a huge plus.
    • Experience maintaining monitoring systems like Nagios and New Relic.
    • MySQL administration experience.
    • Systems and software agnostic– will use the best available tool for the job.

    Desired Skills & Experience

    • Experience with Kafka, ZooKeeper, Elasticsearch, Hadoop or other NoSQL datastore is huge plus.
    • Familiar and comfortable with Apache, Nginx, varnish, Django, Mysql, etc.
    • Experience with Arista switches, Juniper, JunOS, Cisco iOS and network analysis tools
    • Experience with designing and managing networks is huge plus
    • Experience with continuous integration and version control systems– Jenkins, git, etc.

    Benefits & Perks

    As a Contractor You Will Receive The Following Benefits

    • Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)
    • 401(k)
    • Paid Sick Time Leave

We’re reimagining this platform to push the boundaries of learning on the web. You will help build a cutting edge platform that will define the future of online learning. In this role, your strong skills in modern web platforms, data structures and algorithms will be put to the test while you help students save time, save money and get smarter.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • Familiarity with Docker (bonus points for AWS ECS and Convox)
    • Adept in scripting and a strong drive to automate (e.g. through Python, Bash, Ruby, Jenkins, Rundeck, AWS Lambda)
    • Experience with the concept of configuration management (e.g. Chef, Ansible, …)
    • Practical knowledge in systems management tools (e.g. AWS CloudFormation, Terraform)
    • Extensive experience supporting web applications running a Python/Django-stack and nodejs
    • Proficient with Amazon Web Services for production operations
    • Experience with monitoring/reporting technologies (e.g. zabbix, nagios, graphite/grafana, cloudwatch)
    • Capable of quickly analyzing complex problems, understanding dependencies and deducing the root causes
    • A solid OPS foundation - you’re always thinking “What happens if this fails?” when you build things
    • Team player who can jump in and use his or her broad experience to recommend and implement best practices
    • Familiarity with common data stores, e.g. MySQL, Postgres, Mongodb, Cassandra
    • Ability to ‘pick the right tool for the job’, understanding that less is more

      • Desired Skills & Experience

      • Partner with engineering to design and build highly reliable websites and services
      • Contributing member of the automation platform that manages the production services.
      • Lead technology initiatives that drive scalability and reliability
      • Deploy, monitor, and administer high profile web applications and underlying services
      • Be an integral part of our capacity planning and peak preparedness
      • Improve the performance of our web applications and solve scaling issues
      • Write tools and automation that eliminate repetitive tasks
      • Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation

      • Competitive benefits/stock/equity
      • Free daily lunch and snacks
      • Unlimited PTO
      • Pet friendly

    Senior Devops Engineer
    Company Name Workbridge Associates Company Location San Jose, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Senior Devops Engineer

    A industry-leader in transportation technology here in San Jose, this company creates new and innovative platforms for autonomous, connected, and electric vehicles. Your main responsibility will be setting up and maintaining cloud based infrastructure for the companies automotive platform. You will have leeway to define your own solutions. You will be writing code so bring your favorite language like Java, Go or Python. Bring your favorite configuration management tool like Chef, Puppet or Ansible. Bring your favorite logging system such as kafka, rsyslog or logstash. Monitor all the things with nagios, graphite or telegraf. We expect you to know what works and what doesn’t. Now make it all work in all the cloud systems out there, and make sure it doesn’t page us all night.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • 3 years experience in Cloud deployment and operations (AWS, gcloud, Azure)
    • 2 years experience in Container deployment and operations (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos)
    • 2 years experience in Configuration management (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack)
    • 1 year experience Logging infrastructure (Logstash, Kafka, rsyslog, Scribe)
    • 1 year experience Monitoring/metrics (Graphite, InfluxDB, Nagios)

    • Messaging and pub/sub servers (RabbitMQ, Redis, Erlang)
    • Network design and implementation

    • Learn and develop new programming skills
    • Become a mentor to junior developers and get a leadership experience
    • 401K, health, dental insurance
    • Stock option and annual bonuses
    • Free coffee and snacks
    • Gym membership discount

This is a hands-on role that will also require some hands-off leadership and mentoring for the more junior Engineers. This is a 8 month contract position that can pay a base of $100/hr.

    In this role you will be responsible for monitoring, integrating, and making sure that the platform is performing at the optimal level. You will be doing hands-on work with AWS and Kubernetes and will need to having experience scripting in either Python or Ruby. You will also be helping with building up the DevOps team and will get the chance to mentor the more Junior Engineers. This is a great opportunity for anyone who is looking to get leadership and management experience with one of San Francisco most exciting companies.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • AWS experience is necessary
    • Proficiency in configuration management with Chef or Ansible
    • Experience with containers, Kubernetes prefered
    • Experience with scripting (Python, Ruby, Shell, Java, ect.)
    • Good communication and leadership experience

    Benefits & Perks

    • Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)
    • 401(k)

They are looking to bring on a DevOps engineer to help scale out their environment, setting up containers, and migrating next gen tech to their environment.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • Experience with Linux systems and Docker
    • Experience with AWS services, especially CloudFormation and VPCs
    • Writing high quality code in Python
    • Automation skills in configuration management (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt)
    • Strong with CI/CD with Jenkins/Maven/Ant
    • Experience with a Hatchi Corp tool (Terraform, Vagrant, Packer, Consul, Vault, etc.)
    • Infrastructure as a code experience

    • Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits

    • Flexible hours
    • Internal growth
    • First hire of new expansion team

    Company Name Workbridge Associates Company Location Mountain View, CA, US
    Job Link

    Job description

    Build Release/DevOps Engineer

    As a Build Release/DevOps Engineer, you will report to our Director of Infrastructure and be charged with owning the process of releasing builds into QA, STG, and PRD. You will review, analyze and recommend solutions and tools to improve the software development process – all while maintaining existing build environments and leading the design and implementation of their replacement. This role will be a key member of our Cloud and Infrastructure team, comprised of DevOps, IT, Database, Security, and Technical Support professionals. You will be an integral part of the overall product release process.

    Required Skills & Experience

    • 4+ years of experience in web systems environments which includes web application installations, upgrades, and deployment as well as any servers/ systems that support/ host web applications.
    • 4+ years of software engineering, configuration management and release engineering for large scale SAAS web applications.
    • 5+ years of experience with Linux, Unix and/or Posix Systems.
    • 3+ years of experience in developing solutions on one or more continuous integration tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins or other integrated automation tools.
    • Proficient in scripting languages such as Shell, Perl, or Python.
    • 3+ years with at least one deployment and provisioning tools such as Chef, Puppet, Capistrano.
    • Experience building continuous integration solutions using Repository managers such as Nexus, Artifactory, Archiva using REST or JCR (Java) APIs.
    • Experience with cloud services platform such as AWS (Amazon Web Services) or Google Cloud Platform.
    • Bachelor Degree in Computer Sciences or Information Systems.

    Desired Skills & Experience

    • Ability to review, analyze and recommend solutions and tools to improve the software development process.
    • Can develop and support the app build pipeline (cutting, tagging, and maintaining branches etc).
    • Can develop and maintain scripts used by automated build, deployment and packaging systems.
    • Able to select, deploy, administer and support 3rd party tools as needed, like Jenkins Jobs/Plugins/Settings and Integration through CI/CD platform
    • Trace complex build problems, release issues and environment issues in a multi-component environment.
    • Ability to develop, maintain and enhance key parts of the release procedures and processes. Coordinate release activities with Release Management, Project Management, QA, and Development teams to ensure a smooth and trouble-free roll out of releases.

    Benefits & Perks

    • Competitive salary, stock options, Medical/Dental/Vision and 401K benefits
